title: No survivors after Black Hawk helicopter crashes onto highway: Sheriff's office
description: There are no survivors after a Black Hawk helicopter crashed onto an Alabama highway Wednesday afternoon, the Madison County Sheriff's office confirmed to ABC News.

title: WATCH:  Labradors deliver Valentine's Day cards at children's hospital
description: Two service dogs, Dexter and Pilot, delivered cards and hugs at Children’s Memorial Hermann Hospital in Houston, Texas on Valentine's Day.

title: Two teens charged in death of transgender girl Brianna Ghey
description: Two teens have been charged in death of Brianna Ghey, a transgender girl who had a large following on TikTok and Instagram.

title: Starbucks' Schultz declines to appear before Senate panel
description: Starbucks’ interim CEO Howard Schutz has declined a request to appear before a Senate committee seeking to question him about the coffee chain’s response to an ongoing unionization campaign at the company’s U.S. stores

title: Guaranteed income embraced by largest US counties leaders
description: The Counties for Guaranteed Income hopes to expand cash assistance programs nationwide.

title: Trump pick Malpass stepping down as head of the World Bank
description: David Malpass is stepping down as president of the World Bank, four years after former President Donald Trump picked him to run the 189-nation agency

title: Under pressure, Biden considering speech on Chinese spy balloon, objects shot down
description: The president has yet to extensively address the Chinese spy balloon or the three unidentified objects taken down over North American airspace.

title: Man sues Indianapolis, cop who he says kicked him in head
description: A Black man is suing the city of Indianapolis, its police department and an officer who arrested him in 2021, alleging that the officer kicked him in the face while he was handcuffed

title: Agent honed in on Alex Murdaugh inconsistencies after deaths
description: In an interview two months after Alex Murdaugh's wife and son were killed, investigators zeroed in on inconsistencies in what Murdaugh told authorities about their deaths

title: Moderna says its COVID vaccine will remain free for consumers, even those uninsured
description: Moderna has announced it will provide its COVID vaccine for free to people without insurance, even after government money dries up.

title: 100 million Americans on alert for severe weather
description: 100 million Americans across 30 states are on alert for severe weather as a major winter storm brings heavy snow, high winds and tornado threat.

title: US risks default as soon as July unless debt ceiling is raised, agency estimates
description: The U.S. risks defaulting on its debts as early as July unless the debt ceiling is raised, the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said in a report on Wednesday

title: Actress and model Raquel Welch dies at 82
description: Actress and model Raquel Welch dies at 82.

title: US tracked Chinese spy balloon from launch: Official
description: U.S. agencies tracked the Chinese spy balloon from launch and watched as it may have been inadvertently blown into U.S. airspace, a U.S. official confirmed to ABC News.

title: N Mexico St AD gets vote of confidence after hoops shutdown
description: The chancellor at New Mexico State expressed his confidence in athletic director Mario Moccia less than a week after the men’s basketball team was shut down for what the chancellor said was a culture of bad behavior, egregious violations of the student...

title: Sweden emerges as sudden front-runner to host 2030 Olympics
description: Sweden emerging as the front-runner in a troubled search for a 2030 Olympics host is a surprise in Stockholm

title: Feds preparing for trials in Breonna Taylor police killing
description: Lawyers are set to discuss the federal case against a former Kentucky police officer who fired blindly into Breonna Taylor’s apartment the night she was killed

title: Virginia competes with Maryland to land new FBI headquarters
description: Virginia’s political leaders are making their case for moving the FBI headquarters to the state, arguing that the federal government would be wise to follow the steps of Amazon and other corporate leaders that have come to the commonwealth

title: Austin’s city manager fired over widespread power outage
description: Officials in Austin, Texas, have fired the city’s manager over the delayed response to a massive winter storm that left thousands of residents without power for a week or longer this month

title: Michael Jordan marks 60th birthday with record-making donation
description: NBA superstar Michael Jordan donated to Make-A-Wish to mark his 60th birthday.

title: One of 12 boys rescued from Thai cave dies at British school
description: One of the 12 boys rescued from a flooded cave in Thailand in 2018 after being trapped for more than two weeks has died in England, where he was attending a sports academy

title: Retail sales jump as Americans defy inflation and rate hikes
description: America’s consumers rebounded last month from a weak holiday shopping season by boosting their spending at stores and restaurants at the fastest pace in almost two years, underscoring the economy’s resilience in the face of higher prices and multiple i...

title: Michael Jordan donates $10M to Make-A-Wish for 60th birthday
description: Six-time NBA champion Michael Jordan is celebrating his 60th birthday on Friday by making a $10 million donation to the Make-A-Wish

title: FAA institutes safety review team as acting chief faces lawmakers over problems
description: Federal Aviation Administration acting Administrator Billy Nolen faces the Senate Commerce Committee Wednesday about recent aviation problems.

title: IRS nominee: No audit boost for households under $400,000
description: President Joe Biden's nominee to lead the Internal Revenue Service says that, if confirmed, he will commit to not increasing tax audits on businesses and households making less than $400,000 per year

title: Russian journalist sentenced to 6 years over Ukraine posts
description: A Russian journalist has been convicted of disparaging her country's military and received a six-year prison sentence

title: Tesla to open some of its charging stations, as Biden seeks to expand US network
description: Tesla, for the first time, will open a portion of its U.S. Supercharger and Destination Charger network

title: Waters off New England had 2nd warmest year on record in '22
description: The waters off New England logged the second-warmest year in their recorded history last year

title: Study shows 'striking' number who believe news misinforms
description: A new survey shows fully half of Americans indicate they believe national news organizations intend to mislead, misinform or persuade the public to adopt a point of view

title: Scottish leader, supporter of independence, to resign
description: Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon, a supporter of independence and opponent of Brexit, said on Wednesday she plans to resign.

title: All flights diverted from Frankfurt amid Lufthansa IT glitch
description: Germany’s air traffic control agency said Wednesday that it is diverting all flights away from the country’s busiest airport, Frankfurt, after a problem with Lufthansa’s computer systems caused major disruption at the German airline

title: China expresses support for Sri Lanka ahead of debt meeting
description: China has expressed support for Sri Lanka ahead of a meeting of lenders to poor economies but gave no indication if it might help to cut debts that have plunged the Indian Ocean island nation into financial and political turmoil

title: Lawsuit accuses one hospital's website of sharing patient data with Meta, Google
description: A proposed class action lawsuit alleges Cedars-Sinai hospital in Los Angeles shared sensitive patient data to companies such as Meta and Google for targeted advertising.

title: WATCH:  4 sea turtles rehabilitated, released back into the ocean
description: SEA LIFE Sunshine Coast in Australia successfully released the turtles ahead of a "Clean Up for the Hatchlings" event, a community-led initiative to clean beaches in preparation for breeding season.

title: Magnitude 5.7 quake hits New Zealand, no damage reported
description: The U.S. Geological Survey says a magnitude 5.7 earthquake has struck near the New Zealand capital Wellington as the nation grapples with widespread landslides and flooding days after a cyclone

title: UK inflation falls to 10.1% in January
description: Britain’s inflation rate remained above 10% for a fifth consecutive month in January as consumers continued to struggle with high food and energy prices

title: DOJ seeks to force Trump attorney to testify in documents probe, say sources
description: DOJ investigators probing former President Trump's handling of classified documents have asked a judge to compel one of his Trump's attorneys to testify, say sources.

title: Uvalde school district hires new police officers, while keeping report from public
description: Uvalde, Texas, school district officials announced Monday that they have hired two new school district police officers.

title: WATCH:  Humpback pops up for photo op with whale-watchers
description: A humpback indulged a whale-watcher near Hawaii by posing for a selfie she will never forget.

title: WATCH:  How de-escalation training could change policing
description: A recent study on de-escalation training may provide a path toward safer policing.
